column4: One of these days, RSN, I'm going to start a ubuntu-for-java-developers site/forum/whatever.
ubuntuforums receives funding from canonical
Ah, cool.
maybe?
I'm working on uninstalling the ATI drivers and going back to the ubuntu restricted ATI drivers
good luck
Thanks :-)
sorry, I've tried to do that and failed.. :(
Really?  What'd you end up doing?
going back to the latest drivers - they're the only ones I could get to work
Latest as in the latest in ubuntu's apt servers or the latest from ati's site?
latest as in from ati's site
the ubuntu ones didn't want to play
Ah, I'm trying the drivers from ATI's site right now, but the performance sucks and is glitchy to boot.
tell me about it. what card do you hae?
I'm on a thinkpad t43p with ATI firegl v3200.
I've got a compaq v2000 with a 200m
although I have to say, the drivers work much better on faster computers, I find

The ubuntu gutsy restricve worked great, but suspend didn't work.  Somebody suggested trying the ATI from-the-ati-site drivers but those are turning to be worse... unless I'm missing some kind of config change or something.
that's about what I found -- I never knew why the latest were so much slower
I'm about ready to give up on them (unless you have suggestions).  I'm trying to figure out just how to revert... thinking maybe "apt-get remove" on each of the custom ATI driver packages.
As a start.
that's what I'd suggest... again, good luck :)
